website_summaries.verdict: If you want to scan photographic prints without paying for a film-scanning feature you don't need, the Canon CanoScan LiDE 120 Color Image Scanner should be your top choice.
cons: Extremely limited software with no photo editor

customer_reviews.title: Don’t even think about this scanner if you use a Mac
customer_reviews.text: Will not install on current version of Mac OS. You will spend a half hour trying to figure out what you are doing wrong. Then realize that you are following the instructions perfectly and it still won’t install. Then you will spend another half hour re packing it to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia

customer_reviews.title: CANON SCANNER: JUNK; CHINESE MADE JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Canon has went way downhill, and this scanner is a good example of PLANNED OBSOLESCENCE. This is my SECOND scanner of this model. The first lasted about 24 months; and my second one last only 14 months, when the DIODES went dead. I don't use a scanner very often, and probably scanned less than 200 pages in less than 14 months, since hooking it up. Highly recommend EPSON, which I also have, and have had no problem with EARLY DEATHS like CANON.
customer_reviews.author: j. Michael O'Hara

customer_reviews.title: Warning, DOES NOT WORK on Asus motherboard + Windows 10 setup
customer_reviews.text: This scanner DOES NOT WORK if you have an Asus motherboard together with Windows 10. It will start scanning then randomly lose connection and give you an error saying "Cannot communicate with scanner, check the USB connection" and so on. Disappointing. I researched online and found many other people with the same desktop setup as me with the exact same problem. The consensus is simply that the scanner is incompatible with the specific setup, and Canon is not interested in addressing the issue as of yet. I would avoid for now if you're running this configuration. Replaced the scanner with an Epson one and that one works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Bellafont

customer_reviews.title: Shame on you Canon!
customer_reviews.text: Same issues here. Purchased over a year ago for a family picture scanning project. Never even opened the box it was delivered in from Amazon until today. After multiple attempts to install using several different USB cables, multiple USB ports, and on two separate computers, in addition to updating the drivers on the Canon website - nothing. Cannot get past the error message "USB cable isn't connected." We own many Canon products and have always been very happy. After researching this I find many, many people out there with the same problem. Shame on you Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Leibrand

customer_reviews.title: Ok quality, bad driver for Mac
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the scans are ok. I have two big issues with this product though: 1. Driver for Mac OS Sierra works for scanning purposes, but the buttons don't work at all. 2. I wanted to register my product in Canon website to get driver updates, but the process asked me for my phone number, mailing address and bunch of other non-relevant personal information. So I didn't create the account to avoid possible spams. Email must be the only required field to get driver version update news.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: A great but inexpensive scanner!
customer_reviews.text: It's simple to use, easy to set up. Instead of using the provided software, I used "Hamrick Software VueScan x64" which I have had for years and comes with perpetual updates: A perfect combo with the Canon LiDE Color Image Scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph D. Coons

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: This model replaced the earlier 110 model that I had for 5 years before it failed. This newer model failed after just 9 months of light duty - scanning monthly bills. The failure was due to the light failing to work. This is appallingly poor quality. I would also say that the software UI was worse than the earlier version, being less easy to use and more restrictive. Canon could do with better usability testing before shipping newer versions of software out with their scanners.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Tolley

customer_reviews.title: It is great for accurately scanning old photographs which are faded
customer_reviews.text: Ease of use, speed, range of settings, and sleekness all I would rate 5 of 5 stars...It is great for accurately scanning old photographs which are faded, and torn. The colors are also very true and accurate in the transfer process...5 of 5 stars again! The only thing I have noticed, and this may be common of all scanners. is that it has a problem with black areas of photos...it consistently leaves white dots which I must go in and 'fill'. This is the only reason for not giving the 5th star...if this is problematic for all scanners, then I would change all ratings to 5 of 5.Very pleased overall, and a great price!
customer_reviews.author: James G.

customer_reviews.title: Not for Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: I am a long-time Canon customer. But Canon scanners are not working with Windows 10. This did not work and I will have to get an older operating system computer if I want to use it OR buy a different brand of scanner. I've tried everything and it doesn't work. Don't buy this if you have a Windows 10 computer.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: This scanner is perfect for her
customer_reviews.text: Actually bought for my wife as our other scanner all in one was difficult for her to scan then find the scanned item. This scanner is perfect for her, all she does is place the item on the flatbed scanner, closes the lid and touches one button, automatically identifies what is being scanned, files it in the correct folder than the item opens up for you to print, attach as file etc.. Plug and play through USB connection, no power cord is needed. Unpack scanner, install software with provided disk, starts automatically and tells you when to plug in your scanner via USB. The easiest scanner you will ever use. I run Windows 7 and it is compatible.
customer_reviews.author: James H.

customer_reviews.title: I really like this scanner.
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a few months now and couldn't be happier. It is easy to use and produces great quality photos. I like to scan photos and trading cards in and it does well with both tasks. It also does a good job scanning multiples at one time and automatically separating them out. Great scanner. Setup was also very easy and l like the software to use the scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Roy E Galloway

customer_reviews.title: Not as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: First off the Image Garden interface is horrible, it only scans at 600dpi and I can't change for the life of me. The Image Garden editing software is no better than Microsoft picture editor. Every picture I scan in shows up with artifacts, glare, spots or lines, no matter how many times I scan it. Very frustrating, my little project for a Christmas present is out the window. I can literally get better photos if I take a picture with my Samsung Note 9. I'll continue to mess around with it and update my review if anything changes. But so far its been a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Bolted4Life

customer_reviews.title: I thought it was a good idea to backup pictures
customer_reviews.text: This has saved my life! I scanned so many pictures with it... over 3,000 within the first 2 weeks. I got it for a different purpose, but with all of the storms, I thought it was a good idea to backup pictures. I highly recommend it... very easy... plug and play with Mac. I think PC needs a disk, but it comes with that. I use Mac and it was super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Patrice Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Simple. Efficient. Doesnt' jamb.
customer_reviews.text: Started out with NeatRecept Mobile scanner. The big draw is the software in that it allows you to modify/correct what the scanner cannot pick up. Problem #1. Many receipts just don't get pulled thru the scanner. #2 the software is a bit confusing to use. So...enter the Canon flat bed, USB, Mac friendly scanner. It doesn't give you the same slick software but I really don't need that. What I need is a place to store receipts and other documents. the LIDE 120 does just that with minimal effort. I do need to create folders for specific categories of receipts. .
customer_reviews.author: Always Curious

customer_reviews.title: Basic Scan worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Canon has a good quality products and are conscientious about their clients. There is no company that has state of the art scanner. It is still very manual and for the value paid is just enough. If you get lazy to select an specific folder and are in a hurry it will save it to a designated folder, so later on you can retrieve at your own pace. Yes, you have to do manually every single page. Compare to the Epson WT-2750 is a lot faster. Hey!! there was no more money to spent.
customer_reviews.author: Iggy

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I ended up scanning all of my family's photos from the past 40 years. Works quickly and has great resolution. It sometimes had a hard time determining whether to scan to jpg or pdf sometimes, so it took a few tries. I was able to post everything online for relatives to view. Our basement flooded a few weeks later, and we would have lost all of those memories!
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Great while it worked
customer_reviews.text: Soon after installation this unit occasionally failed to scan and generate failure to connect error messages. The scanner WAS connected because it appeared and disappeared from my device list when I plugged in the connector. I appreciate that it is difficult to detect intermittent failures in testing. In all other regards I would give this product five stars. I'm submitting this as a way of providing information to Canon to prevent this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald H. Ottaway

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan! This scanner became a necessity in the recent re-fi of our home. Seems all the docs the "Loan Processor" did not want/need at the beginning of the re-fi became a "thing'. This scanner saved me time, money and effort in running back and forth to Kinkos. So whenever the "Loan Processor" needed a doc, she had it in less than 15 minutes. And this happened quite frequently. Web based software installed on my Mac easily. Because my Mac Mini does not have a disc drive, the CD was merely window dressing. While I can point and click with the best of them, I found this scanner to be straightforward and intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: W. Nicola

customer_reviews.title: Buy someone else's scanner
customer_reviews.text: You'll need different software to get the best out of this. It may be a 2400 dpi scanner, but the included Canon software will not let you scan at more than 400 dpi. You see, they know what you want, LOL. This scanner is finicky about USB ports, you have to keep trying different ones to get it to finish a scan. Also, after one day it developed a vertical line artifact which could not be calibrated out. I sent it back. It may be cheap but it's virtually useless.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Tomporowski

customer_reviews.title: Such a waste of time
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the 110, this 120 does not come with any software you can do the scans directly. I could not even get this working. Lesson: Try your purchase once you have it not 2 months later where you can't return. I had given 5 stars to Canoscan 110, this one should have ZERO starts but no choice but i star. Such a waste of time. This was the last cannon I bought. Never again!
customer_reviews.author: Bukovski

customer_reviews.title: ... of this family of Canon scanners - it worked like a dream
customer_reviews.text: I used to own an older version of this family of Canon scanners - it worked like a dream. Then I bought this one. I have spent frustrating hours trying to make it work with my brand new computer with Windows 10 (there were no possible conflicts with earlier driver versions etc.). The scanner driver and its attached software seems to be incompatible with Windows 10. Additionally, as soon as this scanner is plug in it causes my graphic software (CorelDraw) to freeze. Stay away from this junk!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Stehlik

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your money
customer_reviews.text: So far I am happy with the scanner. The only reason I did not give it full marks is that of the loud sound it makes while scanning. My concern is in regards to its longevity. It was up and running in no time. The one time I used it to scan a page from a book the lid accommodated the book with no problem. I purchased the scanner to convert photographs into digital format for space reduction. If I could copy both sides of a photo to a pdf file the scanner would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Sprsteel

customer_reviews.title: Lousy Color
customer_reviews.text: Lousy Color. I got it to scan in old photos. They come in all tinted purple even though original was fine. I thought I could correct them easily in photoshop but the scan must alter the basics of the photo. I would not buy unless you can go to some store and test scan. Very dissapointed and rather p.o. I wont buy a Cannon again. I should at minimum get what I see on the original picture but I dont even get that.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Great for bills and occasional receipts
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple scanner with some good features. The buttons on the front don't seem to do anything (though I don't really care about that anyway). That said, the software (on MacOS) is intuitive to use. It's by no means a fast scanner, particularly if you run it at full resolution, but I primarily scan bills, old photos, etc. so it doesn't bother me. I'd highly recommend this scanner for casual usage. If you plan to scan multiple items a day, you may want to seek out something with an auto-feader or at least a faster scan speed.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Quat

customer_reviews.title: product is great, customer service a disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: I like the product a lot. was very disappointed that it was very difficult to connect with very poor directions. I had to call the CS help 3 times to get it working and the fact that the Customer Service is not available on weekends made me furious because that is when I was trying to make a project using the scanner. Two weekends I intended to work on this project and could not get the scanner to work. I have now gotten used to the way this works and am pleased with the scanner but getting it up and running was extremely frustrating without being able to reach anyone on the weekends to help me.
customer_reviews.author: jinmaine

customer_reviews.title: Not for Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: May work on other PCs, but not on Windows 10. Spent many frustrating hours trying to make it work. The instructions showed icons to click which were NOT displayed on my computer. It might work for single pages, but not for multi-page documents.
customer_reviews.author: Christie Pollard

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I will save full judgement after a years ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I will save full judgement after a years use. I understand users differ on requirements. I've jotted down what I use this for. If you use this for the same things I do then take my review into account. Also another great thing about it is it runs on your computers power. What I use it for: 1. For quick scanning of pictures for archiving 2. Needed to be semi portable - (taking back and forth to work in a backpack)
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Made a difficult task much easier!
customer_reviews.text: Scanning is usually not my idea of a good time, especially when the task is upwards of 500 photos and cards to be assembled into a book. This scanner made short work of my project - I love that I could scan seven or eight small items at once and have them made into separate .jpeg files. The scans are relatively quick, the settings are easily customized and accessed, and the quality of the scans is excellent. The editing software (via download from Canon's web site) is simple and basic, but for cropping and rotating, it filled the bill perfectly. I prefer this little scanner over the built in scanner of my Canon MX410 fax/copier/scanner. Excellent value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: A Good Document Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I installed this scanner on a Windows 8 and a Windows 10 computer. Works fine. The newer, faster Windows 10 computer installed much faster. This is a inexpensive flatbed scanner that is made by a leader in imaging products. I have a top of the line Canon scanner that can batch scan slides and negatives at high resolution. This one does not scan at high resolution. Canon supports the low end, but not their high end products. I've lost capability, but I will not buy a high end scanner from Canon when it becomes a paperweight when operating systems change.
customer_reviews.author: rayja

customer_reviews.title: Fast, good quality photos with no cropping!
customer_reviews.text: Takes no time to scan loads of pictures with no cropping or rotating involved. My wife has a full tote of old, unsorted family photos to go through, and this scanner is 100x better than the all-in-one printer we were trying to use.
customer_reviews.author: Thechoochlyman

customer_reviews.title: Flawless after fixing problem with Install CD
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner but with a terrible installation problem. You must manually delete any old Canon Scanner folders on Drive C:\Windows\Program Files(X86)\Canon before installing the LiDE120 CD, or else the scanner will hang up, fail with error messages & more. Runs flawlessly when old Canon folders are deleted first before install. I sent a message to Canon Tech Support regarding this problem. The first thing any install CD should do is to delete any old files & folders before install. FV
customer_reviews.author: F. Van

customer_reviews.title: Photo Scan feature is the BEST.. real time saver
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this scanner for the sole purpose of digitizing some very old family pictures that were getting damaged in the albums they were in and make them easier to view (plus save some space on the shelves). There is feature of this scanner which is so valuable for my project... Photo Scan. I can put multiple photos on the glass start the scan and it is intuitive enough to sense and separate each picture into an individual digital copy! Had no problems with loading the software....it works very well in Windows 10 OS and Windows 7 OS, no glitches to date.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner, minor software issues
customer_reviews.text: Really good scanner. This came highly recommended for scanning photos to digital. I love that I can place more than one photo on the scanner at a time and it scans them to separate JPGs, crops the photos and saves them directly to a flash drive as I designated. I would give the product 5 stars if I didn't keep having glitches with the software. I use a laptop with Windows 10 and will try reinstalling software.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Spence

customer_reviews.title: great little scanner
customer_reviews.text: What a great little scanner! So quick and easy to use. It makes scanning old family photos a breeze, which is the main reason I bought it. The best feature in my opinion is the ability to put four 3x4 prints and scan them all at once. The software that comes with the scanner recognizes that there are four separate photos and ,after scanning, gives you four files! That feature alone make it worth the money! Great value as well.
customer_reviews.author: V. Dudley

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: This scanner does not work well. Although convenient, you have to scan the item over multiple times to get a clear picture. Otherwise a rainbow of colors is seen. Would not buy again. I should of returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Hall

customer_reviews.title: Nice Scanner, terrible doucmentation
customer_reviews.text: As someone else wrote, my all-in-one printer no longer scans due to the manufacturer no longer updating the scanning software. We decided to get a stand-alone scanner that could scan both documents and photos. Of course, I immediately had to scan a multi-page document for business. Figuring out how to do that with the provided manual proved to be impossible. After a few hours of poking around, I finally figured out how to scan multi-pages, and how to make the scans go where I wanted them to. If anyone wants me to post the exact instructions, just post a comment to this review and I'll edit it, otherwise, no use boring everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Rosebud

customer_reviews.title: Software is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Used the LiDE110 for many years, was happy with it. Finally died and got this. Waste of money. The scanner is fine. The software was created by idiots. I scan a receipt, and I get an image file showing certain parts of the receipt, sometimes as multiple files. It decides what sections I need scanned. Hopeless. Now I have to retain small receipts and business cards as letter size PDF files. Won't return, but will NEVER BUY A CANON SCANNER AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: hilo_reader

customer_reviews.title: Great photo scanner
customer_reviews.text: Great photo scanner. This can scan up to 6 older small 3" photos, and each one is "filed" as an individual picture. I scanned pics from photo albums from the 70's to present day, then uploaded to Shutterfly or Collage and made books. This scanner made this undoubting task much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Baxtemp

customer_reviews.title: Amazing but...
customer_reviews.text: I had to read a particular review to download the executable on Canon's website to download for this. That's why it has 4 stars. Otherwise it is REALLY easy to plug in, use and put away if that's how someone like me uses it. Quality is awesome, it's fast and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Software Constantly Freezes
customer_reviews.text: Meh. The software constantly freezes when I try to scan - takes 2 to 3 times before it actually scans correctly. Using this after a fresh install of Windows 10. UPDATE: Decided to return this after screwing with it and my computer settings for 2 weeks. I also looked online and apparently this is a Windows 10/8.1 problem. I saw a number of discussions where no one had problems in Windows 7. Fix your crap software Canon. If you have Windows 8.1 or higher do not buy this! I purchased the Epson V19 scanner, and have had no problems with it. The Epson also has better scanning quality.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Walls

customer_reviews.title: the buttons on the scanner are basically useless because the app just won't respond to them properly
customer_reviews.text: A reasonable device mired by broken, heavy-weight software. If you're on a Mac, the buttons on the scanner are basically useless because the app just won't respond to them properly.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Frisby

customer_reviews.title: Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of genealogy and this scanner is easy to use and great for scanning my photos and documents. Also compact enough to take with my laptop to places for research.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle B.

customer_reviews.title: good quality scanner and this was exactly what I got ...
customer_reviews.text: Is anyone else tired and frustrated by those blue tooth 4 in 1 printers/scanners/copiers?? I wanted a basic, good quality scanner and this was exactly what I got with this product. One outstanding surprise is that when I put four photos on the screen at the same time, it delivered them into the folder as four separate photos.....no cropping required!! As I was scanning about 600 photos, that feature alone made this worth it. Directions were easy and straightforward, just plug the USB cord into your computer, and get to work.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Beware the USB Connection
customer_reviews.text: I use the scanner once a year - for taxes.... scan my documents then throw it back into the closet. It made it through two years ..... just about 20 pages of scans. The issue - the usb connector in the scanner broke free and so it will no longer connect. Why did it break free? Maybe I hit the cable wrong, maybe I pushed it in too hard, just some bad luck? Who knows. Will I buy another one? Yeah - for $60 maybe it'll last longer this time.... who knows..... just be aware that you need to mind that connection.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn R.

customer_reviews.title: Needed a scanner
customer_reviews.text: so I got this. The scanning works so far. The software is worse than my canon mp500 which recently died. Why can you not scan multiple pages into one document? The buttons didn't work, so I googled and saw a solution, reran the installer as administrator. Buttons worked for the rest of the day. Come back a day or 2 later, buttons no longer work. Sigh, I can live without the buttons, but seriously?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor written instructions with no trouble shooting guide
customer_reviews.text: Both first and replacement scanners failed to be energized by any of my 3 Mac computers. With first, I spoke with canon, but was cut off after a few interactions - said scanner was defective. Next, I tried canon tech support, but no one answered the telephone. I spoke with Amazon tech support, but that went so slow, I gave up on it. Poor written instructions with no trouble shooting guide, and nothing on the canon website. 2 scanners, 2 duds, no help, apparently defective products = byebye canon!
customer_reviews.author: David L. Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get a compact dedicated scanner to scan a bunch of old photo albums. I was debating between this and the Epson V19 and eventually settled on the Canon LiDE120. I'm glad I did because this scanner delivers great scans for a lower price. The software that it comes with is pretty cool in that I can put multiple photos on the scanning bed and it will automatically save each photo as separate files and crop them. What a time saver! So even so this is slightly slower than the Epson, the software makes this scanner faster and more efficient because it produces more image files in one scan.
customer_reviews.author: BryGuyMcFly

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, no problems so far. Much better than my last scanner! I use it for scanning art and the images always scan in high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Lei

customer_reviews.title: The price point is great and this item is a great value
customer_reviews.text: I've trusted Canon in the past and this continues with this product. I needed a simple at home solution for taking copies of our small business and home files. This work well enough for what it is. The price point is great and this item is a great value. I wish that the Canon companion applications could help print multiple pages to one PDF, but that is not the product itself.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Quality for Its Price - With an Annoying Size Limitation
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little scanner for its price. Been using it to scan artwork and can say that the 600 dpi slow scan setting makes a big positive difference. Will say that a downside is the small scan area and the fact that the glass is not flush with the plastic border. This causes anything about a quarter inch before it overflows out of the scanning area to be a little blurry - not a big deal unless you're scanning art. Also, scanning color is not great, but any basic color adjust (i.e. photoshop) will bring it back to the same color quality as the original work.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Hind

customer_reviews.title: RUN AWAY does not work for MAC Computers!
customer_reviews.text: DOES NOT WORK FOR MAC Computers!!!! I have downloaded the driver and no help. I was out of town or I would have returned it. SHAME ON YOU CANON!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: perfect for very occasional use
customer_reviews.text: perfect for very occasional use, this scanner is slow as hell. the quality of the scans though is good. so if you, like me, want to use this to scan some mail you receive and want to keep digitally, it's perfect. for an office use, you might want to look for a more expensive, faster one. one of the reason I bought this very model is that it is powered by its USB cable only, no need for an additional adapter, therefore you don't need to keep it on your desk all the time. that's the positive point. by the way it works perfect on mac.
customer_reviews.author: Sylveszter

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I hate this scanner so much. I don’t know if it just doesn’t work well with Macs or is just plain unintuitive, but basically trying to use it is just a series of pushing the same button over and over again in hopes that this time you won’t get the error message that it’s not connected. (Spoiler alert: IT IS CONNECTED.) It’s the living worst and I need to find another one to archive all my old photos.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this daily for a couple weeks downloading old family pics and have nothing but praise for it! It quickly and efficiently scans my photos in. I like that I don't have to have it plugged into an outlet but just into the computer. Some reviews talked about the noise - it's not that loud and it's a motor so it's going to make a bit of noise. Great purchase and I wish I would have got one sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner, re-named software functions.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice scanner to replace obsolete unit. Worth 5 stars except that the software, which was clear and easy to understand on old unit, has now followed Microsoft into the realm of strange new and non-understandable names for functions, tied to unrelated cutesy little pictures. Image Garden? Shades of Windows 8.1, Batman, who told an engineering team to do this, and WHY? Love the scanner, hate the cartoon like interface.
customer_reviews.author: ETU

customer_reviews.title: Tow junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I needed a name brand scanner that would last, instead I used it three times and now it says power cable is disconnected or cannot complete scan. It is a total piece of crap fires up warms up scans half a sheet then says there's a problem. Uninstall the program reinstalled it is a turd I would never recommend buying this thing again should have known consider the style of micro USB plug-in it had from the early 2000s that it was old and outdated.
customer_reviews.author: jason hales

customer_reviews.title: A solid scanner
customer_reviews.text: Needed this for a project my company was working on and it worked great. It scans pretty quickly and i haven't had any problems with it. The controls are all self-explanatory and its really easy to use. The quality of the photos is quite nice and the resolution for scanning is perfect for photographs or documents. I've only used cloud features to see how they work, but i haven't had any problems with it. It seems to hook-up to wi-fi just fine. I personally like the feature on it that allows you to immediately convert something to pdf. This feature is really useful if you scan many documents at all.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smithe

customer_reviews.title: Good scanner, but don't install the photo software that ...
customer_reviews.text: Good scanner, but don't install the photo software that comes with it. The basic software required to use it is good enough. My drawings come out really in this scanner.
customer_reviews.author: NIKtendo

customer_reviews.title: Great little scanner
customer_reviews.text: Great little scanner. Powered by a USB port, so set up was very easy. If is very fast and has better quality scans than my old HP 6200C, which cost much more. The shipping service was extremely FAST! The USPS delivered it on a Sunday! I have two minor complaints - 1) The UBS cable could be longer. 2) The HTML instruction manual isn't very good either. Updated two years later and the software doesn't work with Windows 10. Canon updated the driver, but the scanner is not very useful without software. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bill W

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner
customer_reviews.text: Great little scanner. Very easy to use, plug-n-play. Handy buttons on side for quick work. Software perfectly adequate for routine scanning. Had the prior model that I liked but had to get this one because my new computer didn't have a dedicated printer port anymore. This model is USB which makes it easy.
customer_reviews.author: Mileage May Vary

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot! Small, does the job. I just hate how sometimes the document scans in a tilted way, hence the 4 stars. But otherwise, I’ve used to scan hundreds or pages so far. And still good
customer_reviews.author: Eric Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: My computer won't recognize this scanner.
customer_reviews.text: I could not get this scanner to work with Windows 7. The installation CD did not work. I tried downloading drivers from both Canon's European site and U.S. site; had difficulty locating and navigating the U.S. site. Finally after 3 days and much frustration, tried calling Canon tech support. Although the guy that helped me was pleasant, he couldn't solve the problem either. I am not sure if it was a driver malfunction or a short in the chord, but my computer would not recognize the device. Returned the product.
customer_reviews.author: leslies_library

customer_reviews.title: Excellent scanner for it's price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my desk so I don't have to use my printer's built-in scanner. I found this to be a superior scanner overall. It's powered by the USB cable that it uses for it's data connection, which my past CanoScan scanner did as well. This has some additional features through it's software that were nice additions. The scanner has some handy buttons on it's front which can make scanning even quicker. The scans are extremely nice and very high resolution for this price range scanner. This scanner exceeded my needs and I'm very happy with it's price for it's features.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Black

customer_reviews.title: The program to scan (the driver) comes in Apple laptops already
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I was about to download the specific driver from cannon but if you have a Mac it’s already comes with image capture which is pretty good just search it up and use that and it works great
customer_reviews.author: Raphael

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This sleek black scanner is a cinch to set up and many of the commands can be done from your computer screen. A CD is included which installs the drives and command modules. I like particularly that creating a PDF is one of the options. If you just want to scan without a printer or fax attached it's the way to go. The scanned copies are sharp and true to color and you can direct the machine to store them where you like, in my case in My Documents.
customer_reviews.author: P. B. Sharp

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good low-cost scanner for documents and photos
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good low-cost scanner for documents and photos. I really like the fact that it is powered right from the USB cable, with no need for a power cord and AC adapter. It makes really good photo scans, although they sometimes need a bit of color correction in post production. For the money, it is a very good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Point Man

customer_reviews.title: Good price - hope it lasts
customer_reviews.text: Scanner is nice, light, easy to use, and low price. Kind of annoyed this is my 4th scanner in about 10 years. Just not robust, but conversely, not going to pay hundreds of dollars for something used sporadically. Not a big fan of the new Canon Utilities software - what they previously provided with the 110 model I used to have was so simple and easy. This s/w is follows the model that "had to keep improving, even if it did not need it".
customer_reviews.author: MagMan

customer_reviews.title: Run, fast. This is cheap and WILL break.
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. Lasted less than a year when the usb input was pushed inside the case and I could not access it. I don't have the necessary tools to open the case and reroute the shrinking input so into the garbage this trash goes. This thing literally sat on my desk with only a few uses so don't blame misuse for the failure. Waste of money if you want this to last more than a year. Terrible shame, considering the less expensive scanner I bought in 2006 (that had a LOT more use, btw) lasted nearly five years before it failed.
customer_reviews.author: Alison D.

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed as I have had 3 Canon 3/1 printers prior ...
customer_reviews.text: It is not compatible with Java, Unable to use to upload checks so I could not do any online banking. Cannon iis aware of the problem and their statement to me was," we do not guarantee it will work with other equipment not manufactured by Canon. I was very disappointed as I have had 3 Canon 3/1 printers prior to this. I will never buy anything made by Canon again. My Canon 3/1 printer scanner stopped functioning after several years, I had hoped to just add a scanner and continue on. I now have a Epson 3/1 printer that works fine.
customer_reviews.author: joey

customer_reviews.title: I love this little scanner
customer_reviews.text: I love this little scanner. I have an MacBook Air and it was lickety-split to connect. I am doing family research so I have been going to relatives homes to scan photos. I can take this little scanner and my laptop in my tote bag and plug in and scan to my heart's content. Easy to use and great pricing! Another great thing about buying a Canon product is their WONDERFUL customer service. I had trouble connecting my Canon wireless printer to my wireless router and they spent at least thirty minutes helping through it.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara R

customer_reviews.title: Cheap functional
customer_reviews.text: Used to scan b/w images so I can't comment on color. Works great. Scanners don't get much better than this.
customer_reviews.author: MN

customer_reviews.title: Excellent scanner for the price
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for 2 years now. No problems with scanning into JPGs, PDFs. Some people might have gotten a lemon hence the low ratings, but overall this product is excellent. Takes about 15 seconds for each scan, so it's not as fast, but that's what you'd get for the price of only $50. For your occasional scan purposes this item is worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: LambertRK

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this quagmire
customer_reviews.text: Canon's software would not install to use this scanner. Google "LiDE 120 and failed to install Administrator rights" and you will see a plethora of complaints. I attempted EVERY suggestion to no avail. DO NOT PURCHASE. Just my .02...
customer_reviews.author: Bookin Weasel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for a laptop on the move
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for to keep my laptop exclusively for my family tree research. Its light weight, mobile and powered only by the USB going to the laptop. Everything I use to add files, pictures & research fits in my laptop travel tote. None of the extra weight, wires or need for more carriers.
customer_reviews.author: DIRTY RALPH

customer_reviews.title: Works great as expected
customer_reviews.text: Works great as expected. It gets all its power from the USB ports. I only scan things on occasion so i can easily put this away when not in use to save desk space. You can scan one-page PDF directly from the button on the scanner. However, you can also scan multi-page PDF from the PC software. Wished they could have combined this onto the button also. But the scan quality is fine for my document scanning needs which is 300dpi or 600dpi. I don't do much in photographs as nobody uses film anymore. Overall, it works as expected and good price value.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Deng

customer_reviews.title: Was easy to install software on Win10
customer_reviews.text: Great small lightweight scanner. Easy to install software on my Windows 10 operating system notebook pc. I'm using it primarily to help me go paperless and scanning documents to PDF.
customer_reviews.author: Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Nice Scanner!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little uneasy since the price was so low but it is a very basic scanner with just a few buttons and no screen or anything no one wants anyways. Easy to use, great if you do not want a dedicated place for a scanner. It plugs into the computer, that's it! Full-color and nice image. I have a mac and just went to the Canon website for the software--- too easy! I am a student and on the go a lot, this is the size of a laptop so it is very mobile. If you are doing field work, you can literally have a mobile office with this baby!
customer_reviews.author: KayakFisherman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Will scan and crop multiple photos at one time. I was afraid I would be scanning one at a time and having to crop each one individually. It does it for you. I can lay four 4x6 photos on the glass and it will scan and crop them as individual jpeg files with one pass. I'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell

customer_reviews.title: LiDe 120 will not scan a full size A4 letter item at 2400, 4800 or 9600dpi, requires significant reduction in target size
customer_reviews.text: The box claims unit can scan to 2400dpi, 4800 and 9600, but it does not copy A4 letter size items at that resolution. It requires you to reduce target item size to something quite a bit smaller. Used a Canon printer scanner before and their software was good, but this is not so with the LiDE120. I need higher resolution at A4 size so unfortunately will probably have to buy another one from a different manufacturer. Very disappointed with this item!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Mickey

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly, sets up instantly, don't even need to use the on-screen menu (which isn't intuitive), just push the button in the front of the scanner for the function you want to use. I use the scanner to create PDFs of work contracts that I have to sign in ink and email -- just put the signed document on the glass, close the top, press the PDF button, and it scans the doc to computer hard drive and brings its location up on the computer screen to be named, saved, and emailed.
customer_reviews.author: TexasGal

customer_reviews.title: Great Canon Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I rate this canon LiDE 120 scanner at 5 stars because it is my second Canon scanner, and they both have been great products. You will have trouble with the driver and software, which installs as one package from the included CD, but if you go to the Canon USA website, look up this model, and install the stand alone driver, you will not have any trouble at all. The other software, mostly third party, is not needed anyway. You might want to download one of the manuals however, just for the sake of having it to refer to now and again. Great scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Probably a good product.  Wish it had a manual that came with it.
customer_reviews.text: I this came with an actual user manual it would be a wonderful addition to my office. A request has been made to Canon for a hard copy manual and they have yet provided one even though they promised one. What was promised in 2 to 4 weeks has now turned in to 8 to 10 weeks and counting. Online manuals just do not cut it for the average user.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Solved a real problem for us.
customer_reviews.text: This is an inexpensive way to solve a problem we had with our printer. The printer (a Brother 9840CDW color laserjet) is over ten years old, and the bulb used for scanning, faxing and copying is getting dim. It does not seem to be a user-reparable item, and we needed to be able to copy and scan. the LiDE 120 is perfect for our purposes - it copies items by passing them straight through to our printer, and scans items to a file on my computer. Since it gets its power through the USB plug it doesn't require a power supply connection. Excellent device.
customer_reviews.author: J.P.P.

customer_reviews.title: A nice little scanner for the price
customer_reviews.text: This does a fine job when a scanner is needed. I had been using my phone for copies, but the quality was poor. This provides excellent quality scans. It however, does not have its own power source and must be connected directly to a computer (thereore, not wireless in any way).
customer_reviews.author: RSKH

customer_reviews.title: Poor Product - Don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: I had a Canon LiDE 100 for several years and it gave me excellent service. I had to buy a new scanner and I bought the Canon LiDE 120. BIG mistake! Had nothing but trouble starting with my first use. Recommend that you avoid this disaster. For more well detailed documentation as to its major problem, click on:  I just returned it to Amazon as it is defective. FYI, I am running Win 10 on a Dell desktop with all updates and patches installed.
customer_reviews.author: howard297320533

customer_reviews.title: More Information
customer_reviews.text: The scanner works well and I am pleased with it. The only suggestion I would make would be for the instructions could be simpler, or plainer. The online manual should spell out all the information I might need to operate efficiently and how to do all the things the scanner is built to do. All I could find was an outline...then to go back and click every item in the outline. Even then, I'm not sure the directions are as clear as they might be.
customer_reviews.author: GoodSeller+

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the trouble
customer_reviews.text: Unreliable at the best of times due to flaky drivers, this scanner stopped working entirely after 2 years of light use. When it worked without the software hanging or crashing, it worked well, but between its temperamental ways and the premature hardware failure, I can't recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: RCL

customer_reviews.title: I love this little scanner
customer_reviews.text: I needed a cheap scanner because I replaced my old HP all-in-one printer with a higher quality printer without scanning capabilities. I mainly used the scanner for scanning photos but I do occasionally work at home and used it to scan documents. I love this little scanner! It runs circles around my old HP - clear, crisp (not crooked) perfect photo scans and it even does multiple page pdf scans (you still have to put each page on the scanner separately). Very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Patty1301

customer_reviews.title: connected easily, very handy because it takes its power from ...
customer_reviews.text: Compact, connected easily, very handy because it takes its power from the USB connection of the computer, thus eliminating the need for a power supply "brick" and accompanying cables etc. The output quality seems fine. My only wish is that it had an ON/OFF switch, which it does not - it powers up the moment it is connected via its USB cable - and the lack of an "ON" light or other indication that it is "alive."
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and never got around to opening it....just opened it up today to use for the first time...and its a dud....to late to return...my fault...and out the money. Going straight in the trash. Don't be like me...open this piece of junk up right away and make sure it works. Mine does not.
customer_reviews.author: Liendeni

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but for low-usage installations and $50 price tag, works fine ...
customer_reviews.text: Works really well, especially the scan-to-pdf feature. The mechanical construction (gears driving the scanning head, etc.) is a bit cheesy, and noisy, but should be OK if you only want to scan an item or two a day. If you're going to do a LOT of scanning, find something else. Oh yes, it's a little counterintuitive, but when you scan a page, you have to insert it face down (as expected) and upside down (NOT as expected). Once you get used to it, it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This works good. It'd be annoying
customer_reviews.text: I bought to scan books, paper (receipt, letter, etc.) and photos. This works good. It'd be annoying, however, if you scan an old copy of music score. Because the print does not appear so clearly on this kind of document, I have to scan it as "photo", not "document." Then, the image sometimes automatically gets separated by line. Hope I can find the way to preset the size of scanned image.
customer_reviews.author: Orso Poppy

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected and performs well for an economical price. Did not want an all in one cartridge printer anymore. Too expensive to operate. This allowed us to purchase an inexpensive laser printer and an inexpensive scanner. Easy to install the software.
customer_reviews.author: T. Frantz

customer_reviews.title: Not working after 4 years
customer_reviews.text: Not sure 4 years is too old or what. I bought it 4 years ago and haven't used it often. Now the scanner can only produce all black image. paid $59.99 for 4 years. guess not too bad for the price?
customer_reviews.author: evelyn

customer_reviews.title: I set the scanner up and started using it straight ...
customer_reviews.text: I set the scanner up and started using it straight away. No problems. USB plug and play powered for convenience means this scanner is tucked out of the way until I need it. The packaged software is OK and convenient for button pushers, but I already own VueScan by Hamrick software and that has all the functionality I need. Those two pieces make this an unbeatable value combination.
customer_reviews.author: bruce

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT order the extra cable USB 2.0 A-male chord it requires the 2.0 Mini B
customer_reviews.text: The scanner is awesome for my desk, and well worth the cost...it saves me from walking up front in office to use the community scanner.....but the extra long USB 2.0 A-male is not the correct chord... it requites the USB 2.0 Mini B chord.... Go Chiefs !!!!
customer_reviews.author: BoLa Miranda

customer_reviews.title: I love my scanner!
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple scanner, but it is the best one I have ever had. It is quiet and fast. The instructions took a little while to get through, but now I am a speed scanner! I use this mainly for scanning old family photos so I can share them with family members and put some of them on my ancestry file. However, it works great on documents as well. It is very lightweight and easy to store when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: L. Keeling

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner for small home use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great scanner for the price. It also scans in color which is great. All documents I have scanned have been very legible. No issues so far. I just wish I could scan multiple documents without having to insert each document separately which can be very annoying. Overall great scanner.
customer_reviews.author: MarleyChic

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Quality, Especially For Price
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for a Christmas present for my fiancé so we could upload all of our family photos to Google Cloud. I am so impressed with the quality of the images given that it’s not very expensive! I was feeling like it would be a real gamble, but ordered anyway. I’m glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on windows 10
customer_reviews.text: this scanners does not work for windows10. The IJ utility freezes/crashes halfway into a scan. I can't even get 1 page to scan most times. I've reinstalled numerous times. A quick google search has found many people have had the same issue. Basically unusable. Canon support is terrible. I will never buy canon again!
customer_reviews.author: Neil H.

product_meta.title: Canon Office Products LiDE120 Color Image Scanner
product_meta.description: Scanning, Storing & Sharing Made Easy. For troubleshooting assistance kindly contact 1-800-OK-CANON
feature_bullets: The LiDE120 scanner provides a maximum optical resolution of 2400 x 4800 dpi for dazzling scans of both photos and documents

The Auto Document Fix feature automatically produces beautiful scans with advanced image analysis and area-by-area data correction, while Auto Scan Mode3 automatically evaluates the item being scanned and saves it with the appropriate settings

The CanoScan LiDE120 Color Image Scanner is a compact scanner that offers advanced features and affordability; The "Send to Cloud" functionality, for example, lets you upload photos and documents to the Cloud with remarkable ease

The LiDE120 scanner can help you work efficiently with four EZ Buttons that enable you to scan, copy, Send to Cloud or create a PDF in a snap.LiDE120 scanner uses one USB cable for both data and power, so plugging in is easy; Compatible OS : Windows 8, Windows 8.1, Windows 7, Windows 7 SP1, Windows Vista SP1, Vista SP2, Windows XP SP3 32-bit, Mac OS X v10.6.8 - 10.9

Compatible still image formats are PDF created using Canon PDF Creator only, JPEG, TIFF, and PNG, compatible video formats are MOV from select Canon digital cameras only and MP4 from select Canon digital camcorders only, Dimesion (W x D x H) 9.9 x 14.6 x 1.6 Inch

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,268 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
